newsArray.title: Nedbank Cup: When is the Last 16 draw?
creator: Ernest Makhaya
newsArray.description: The 2023 Nedbank Cup is in full swing, and the round of 32 was completed on Tuesday with Chippa United sneaking into the Last 16 on penalties.
newsArray.content: The Nedbank Cup is in full swing, and the round of 32 was completed on Tuesday with Chippa United sneaking into the Last 16 on penalties. ALSO READ: SUNDOWNS BOLSTER TECHNICAL TEAM WITH EX-PIRATES MAN Chippa United needed penalties to beat Motsepe Foundation Championship side Polokwane City at Peter Mokaba Stadium on the night. ALSO READ | FORMER KAIZER CHIEFS MIDFIELDER FINDS A NEW HOME ‚Äì REPORT In doing so, they became the 16th team to qualify for the next round of the Nedbank Cup ‚Äì and therefore, throwing their name into the Last 16 draw. READ | KAIZER CHIEFS SET TO TIE DOWN VETERAN GOALKEEPER‚ÄôS FUTURE WHEN IS THE NEDBANK CUP LAST 16 DRAW? Now, all the 16 teams will be drawn against each other and battle it out for the eight places up for grabs in the Nedbank Cup quarter-finals. The draw for the Nedbank Cup quarter-finals will be conducted on Wednesday, 15 February at SuperSport Studio 6 in Randburg. ALSO READ | PITSO MOSIMANE‚ÄôS AL AHLI RECLAIM TOP SPOT WITH WIN This Nedbank Cup Last 16 draw is scheduled for 18:00, and by 18:30, every single team would have found out who they will face in the next round. READ ALL FOOTBALL RELATED STORIES HERE‚Ä¶

newsArray.title: Key kick-off times as DStv Premiership action returns
creator: Craig Lewis
newsArray.description: There are some key fixtures in the DStv Premiership this weekend as the chasing pack looks to make up some ground on Sundowns.
newsArray.content: Last weekend saw several Nedbank Cup clashes taking place, while Mamelodi Sundowns began their CAF Champions League campaign in victorious fashion. All eyes will be back on the DStv Premiership this weekend, though, with Pirates kicking off action on Friday night against Maritzburg United (19:30). There are three games on Saturday, with Royal AM‚Äôs battle against SuperSport United sure to be an interesting encounter, while Richards Bay will travel to face Sekhukhune United. Meanwhile, AmaZulu will also host TS Galaxy. On Sunday, Kaizer Chiefs will be hoping to come away with a comfortable victory against Golden Arrows, while Cape Town City then round off the weekend with a battle against Swallows. ALSO READ | FINALLY SOME GOOD INJURY NEWS FOR KAIZER CHIEFS Check out the DStv Premiership fixtures for this weekend below: The top half of the log currently looks like this: Runaway leaders Mamelodi Sundowns have played a couple of games more than the teams in the chasing pack, but they have established a virtually unassailable buffer. ALSO READ | CHIEFS LINKED TO AUDACIOUS MOVE FOR NIGERIAN STAR The team is now heading to Cameroon for its second ground B Match against Coton Sport Garoua, and on Tuesday it was confirmed that new set play coach Michael Loftman would be travelling with the team. ‚ÄúThe appointment was made in an effort to raise the bar including a specialist to the Technical Team,‚Äù a Sundowns statement read. ‚ÄúAll elite sport is about gaining small margins. Replays and restarts are a significant part of modern-day football and are even more crucial when playing in the CAF Champions League. ‚ÄúLoftman, who has held various coaching roles as head coach and development coach, holds a UEFA A license from the English FA and a Sports Science & Coaching Masters Degree from Brunel University. In his role, the experienced coach and performance data analyst will work on the pitch and compile analytic data to provide information to improve an important part of the game.‚Äù

newsArray.title: PSL Gossip: Kaizer Chiefs to poach a Soweto talent, Orlando Pirates star‚Äôs flashy Beemer
creator: James Freemantle
newsArray.description: In today's PSL gossip we've got news that Kaizer Chiefs may poach a Soweto rival's player and an Orlando Pirates star's flashy BMW.
newsArray.content: It‚Äôs Wednesday morning which means that it‚Äôs time for some hot PSL gossip. Today we‚Äôve got news of Kaizer Chiefs poaching an academy player from a Soweto rival and an Orlando Pirates star in his slick BMW. ICYMI: Player profile on reported Kaizer Chiefs transfer target Denis Nya! REVEALED: The accumulative transfer fees paid for Benni McCarthy PSL Gossip: 15 February 2023 Orlando Pirates star seen with half a million BMW Playing professional football for a club like Orlando Pirates is not too bad. Check out Ndabayithethwa Ndlondlo‚Äôs BMW. Want the full story?üôÇ What Jose Riveiro told Thembinkosi Lorch Orlando Pirates fans celebrated Thembinkosi Lorch‚Äôs return with a goal. Here‚Äôs what his coach told him before the big return on the grass. Want the full story?üôÇ Everything fans need to know about Kaizer Chiefs target Denis Nya If you‚Äôre a Kaizer Chiefs fan and you‚Äôre excited about rumours linking the club to Denis Nya, you should be! Here‚Äôs everything you need to know about the central defender who played alongside Kelechi Iheanacho. Want the full story?üôÇ Chiefs alerted as academy product sent packing by Swallows Kaizer Chiefs have apparently been given a heads up that midfielder Given Thibedi is available after being released by Swallows. Want the full story?üôÇ That‚Äôs all we have time for today. Until tomorrow! For more insights, analysis and love for the beautiful game, hit up James Freemantle. Meanwhile, follow The South African on Twitter for up-to-the-minute news updates

newsArray.title: Why Matildas are treating the next week as a World Cup dress rehearsal
creator: Vince Rugari
newsArray.description: It‚Äôs hard to pretend that an intimate Thursday night in Gosford gives the same vibes as 80,000 people at a Women‚Äôs World Cup opener. But Matildas coach Tony Gustavsson is going to have a crack.
newsArray.content: It might be hard to pretend that an intimate Thursday night in front of Gosford‚Äôs most famous collection of palm trees gives the same vibes as 80,000 people at a Women‚Äôs World Cup opener. But Matildas coach Tony Gustavsson is still going to have a crack at it. The Cup of Nations is here, and while there‚Äôs a trophy up for grabs, the truth is it‚Äôs meaningless. This is simply a series of friendlies dressed up as a tournament. The winners won‚Äôt be out getting tattoos to commemorate the achievement. This trophy is meaningless - but what it represents is huge for the Matildas and coach Tony Gustavsson. Credit: Getty But that doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs not important. Gustavsson and the Matildas, who face Czechia on Thursday night at Industree Group Stadium, are approaching it as a dress rehearsal for the Women‚Äôs World Cup in every conceivable way - from the three teams they‚Äôll face which were hand-picked to best replicate the attributes of their Group B opponents, to the way they‚Äôll play and even the timing, location and identity of the players who will be made available for their pre-match media commitments. Gustavsson joked he might even practice parts of the speech he‚Äôll give the team before they face Ireland at Accor Stadium on July 20. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve spent two years now talking about, you know how I always say, ‚ÄòOne day better‚Äô? This is now training tournament football,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúMeaning, how do we prepare, how do we win against Czech Republic [if it was] an opening game in a group stage? [That] is going to replicate what we‚Äôre going to talk about when we play Ireland. ‚ÄúEverything we do now is like a World Cup rehearsal. It doesn‚Äôt mean the focus is only on winning in that sense, but we need to train tournament format - how we close that game out and quickly check into something completely different tactically against Spain, and then the same thing [against Jamaica].‚Äù If nothing else, it will be an excellent measure of where the Matildas really sit after a rocky 2022 which began with a poor Asian Cup, hit the skids after concerning losses to Spain, Portugal and Canada, and then improved markedly with a series of impressive friendly performances in October and November.

newsArray.title: Snl24.com | Pique: Why I Have Not Contacted Messi
newsArray.description: Ex-Barcelona centre-back Gerard Pique has revealed why he has not contacted Lionel Messi to congratulate him for winning the 2022 FIFA World Cup with Argentina.
newsArray.content: Ex-Barcelona centre-back Gerard Pique has revealed why he has not contacted Lionel Messi to congratulate him for winning the 2022 FIFA World Cup with Argentina. After the forward left the Catalan giants as a free agent in 2021, rumours suggested that his relationship with Pique had broken down due to the Spaniard's stance over his exit. Spanish publications claimed the since-retired defender had told president Joan Laporta that Messi leaving would not impact the team negatively, with the club chief later deciding against a contract renewal for the Blaugrana's all-time leading goalscorer. Messi and Pique came through the ranks of La Masia together before eventually developing into key players for Barcelona‚Äôs senior team after the Spaniard returned to the Camp Nou following a brief stint at Manchester United. In a recent interview, Pique appeared to hint that their feud is still ongoing when he was asked if he had got in touch with his ex-colleague since his World Cup victory in December. "Not really. I was, and this is crazy but it is true, I didn't watch any game," he said in an interview with social media personality John Nellis, according to . "Just the final, not the whole game. I tried to disconnect. I went on holiday for a few days. "My last few months were tough as a pro and I really needed to disconnect from football." You must be to read and post comments

newsArray.title: Some clarity on Greenwood‚Äôs future, Man United boss reaches out
creator: Craig Lewis
newsArray.description: Embattled Manchester United forward Mason Greenwood is set to see his career remain in limbo for at least the remainder of the season.
newsArray.content: *Note: This is an updated article on Greenwood Last month, it was dramatically confirmed that all attempted rape and assault charges were dropped against Mason Greenwood after more than a year under investigation. However, it still remains to be seen what actions United will take, with the only statement to date reading as follows: ‚ÄúThe club will now conduct its own process before determining next steps. We will not make any further comment until that process is complete.‚Äù In an update reported on by The Daily Star , the internal probe will apparently could go on for several more months, and all signs suggest that there is no chance Greenwood will be considered for selection this season. The 21-year-old remains contracted to United until the middle of 2025, but has not played for the Red Devils since January 22 last year. It‚Äôs expected that the club will now interview Greenwood to ascertain his version of events and will also get specialists in to assess his mental and physical state. ALSO READ | FINALLY SOME GOOD INJURY NEWS FOR KAIZER CHIEFS It‚Äôs also been reported that United manager Erik Ten Hag got in touch with the youngster over the phone after the case was dropped. ‚ÄúThe manager enquired how he was feeling physically and mentally and said he was pleased the charges had been dropped,‚Äù a source told The Sun High-profile football publication, The Athletic , recently approached several female supporters to find out their views on any possible return for Greenwood, with the publication stating that ‚Äúwomen‚Äôs voices have been largely absent‚Äù during this story. Natalie Burrell, the founder of United Women‚Äôs Supporters‚Äô Club made her position clear: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think he should play again for Manchester United. It‚Äôs one of the biggest clubs in the world. They need to make a statement and letting him back would be the worst thing they could do. It would set our club back in terms of what we‚Äôre trying to do with our women‚Äôs team and campaigns like Her Game Too which are trying to encourage women to play and watch football.‚Äù ‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt want to see him training. I don‚Äôt want to see him in a [United] kit. I don‚Äôt want to see him ever coming out at Old Trafford again.‚Äù Another die-heard fan, named Gina, said there was no doubt about what the club should do: ‚ÄúWhile ‚Äòcharges dropped‚Äô is not conclusive either way, if there is any doubt from United that he is guilty of these allegations then I do not feel he should play for United, or any other club, again.‚Äù A third fan, 33-year-old Kaydee, echoed these sentiments. ‚ÄúThey definitely shouldn‚Äôt have him back ‚Äì not after how far the game has come to promote women. It‚Äôs just not acceptable and a club like United should know better.‚Äù READ | MASON GREENWOOD COMMENTS AFTER RAPE CHARGES DROPPED GREENWOOD HAS STILL BEEN BANKING A SIGNIFICANT SALARY FROM UNITED Towards the end of June, it was confirmed that Greenwood had his police bail extended once again as investigations continued after damning videos and images came to light on the social media account of former girlfriend Harriet Robson . Greenwood has since remained under ongoing investigation for the better part of the last year. However, a Crown Prosecution Service spokesperson explained at the start of 2023 why charges had been dropped. ‚ÄúWe have a duty to keep cases under continuous review. In this case a combination of the withdrawal of key witnesses and new material that came to light meant there was no longer a realistic prospect of conviction. In these circumstances, we are under a duty to stop the case. ‚ÄúWe have explained our decision to all parties. ‚ÄòWe would always encourage any potential victims to come forward and report to police and we will prosecute wherever our legal test is met.‚Äù In a short statement released on his behalf, Greenwood commented: ‚ÄúI am relieved that this matter is now over and I would like to thank my family, loved ones and friends for their support. There will be no further comment at this time.‚Äù Increasingly it appeared that his future with Manchester United would be viewed as untenable, but it now remains to be seen what stance the club will take.

newsArray.title: Snl24.com | Main Siya Stories
newsArray.description: Soccer Laduma‚Äôs latest edition, issue 1311, is out on the shelves with our exclusive Siyagobhoza.
newsArray.content: Soccer Laduma‚Äôs latest edition, issue 1311, is out on the shelves with our exclusive Siyagobhoza. In the latest issue, the Siya crew reveals the news on your favourite teams as well as footballers. Pirates Waiver Cut Of Foster‚Äôs Record R210m Transfer? Ralani Contemplating His Sundowns Future Insider Confident That Jali Will Stay At Chloorkop Bucs Striker Coach Signed Short-Term Deal Chiefs Table Offer For Molefe Big Clubs Banging On The Door For Maseko Mahamutsa To Play And Coach At VTM City To Exercise Mdantsane Option Amid Chiefs Interest Billiat Unlikely To Rule Out Move Abroad? Khuzwayo To Leave PSL For Downs? Young SA Quartet Head Out For Portugal Experience Agent Confirms Mazibuko‚Äôs Callies Exit Chiefs Join Pirates In R10m Tour√© Chase? You must be to view and post comments. Click to Register!

newsArray.title: 'Significant' penalties promised if gender balance on boards not met by Irish sporting bodies
creator: news@irishmirror.ie (Michael Scully)
newsArray.description: Minister Thomas Byrne: 'We don‚Äôt want to do anything that reduces participation in sport but we are serious about this"
newsArray.content: THERE will be no leeway given on Sport Ireland's end of year deadline for sporting bodies to hit gender balance targets on their boards - and "significant" financial penalties imposed on those who fail. "I want that message sent loud and clear," said Sports Minister Thomas Byrne. "But I have said that to the governing bodies and, in fairness, we have seen them make statements on that and that's very welcome.‚Äù READ MORE: Outgoing FAI chief highlights football funding shortfall compared to GAA and rugby Minister Byrne added that no decision has been made yet on the financial punishment that will be doled out. He said: "The word I have used is ‚Äòsignificant‚Äô. That is the word I have used in the D√°il. "What‚Äôs important is that officials are working with Sport Ireland on that. We don‚Äôt want to do anything that reduces participation in sport but we are serious about this. ‚ÄúMost sporting bodies are doing this, or are on the way of doing this. Even some who have very few female members are talking to us about getting more through the ranks. ‚ÄúThe IRFU have made an announcement, the FAI have signalled it in terms of the retirement of the chairman, and I‚Äôve spoken to the GAA as well, who are in discussions in terms of merger with the LGFA etc - that would solve the issue. ‚ÄúIn the meantime this has to happen by the end of the year or there will be significant funding reductions." READ NEXT: Get the latest sports headlines straight to your inbox by signing up for free email alerts

newsArray.title: 'Significant' penalties promised if gender balance on boards not met by Irish sporting bodies
creator: news@irishmirror.ie (Michael Scully)
newsArray.description: Minister Thomas Byrne: 'We don‚Äôt want to do anything that reduces participation in sport but we are serious about this"
newsArray.content: THERE will be no leeway given on Sport Ireland's end of year deadline for sporting bodies to hit gender balance targets on their boards - and "significant" financial penalties imposed on those who fail. "I want that message sent loud and clear," said Sports Minister Thomas Byrne. "But I have said that to the governing bodies and, in fairness, we have seen them make statements on that and that's very welcome.‚Äù READ MORE: Outgoing FAI chief highlights football funding shortfall compared to GAA and rugby Minister Byrne added that no decision has been made yet on the financial punishment that will be doled out. He said: "The word I have used is ‚Äòsignificant‚Äô. That is the word I have used in the D√°il. "What‚Äôs important is that officials are working with Sport Ireland on that. We don‚Äôt want to do anything that reduces participation in sport but we are serious about this. ‚ÄúMost sporting bodies are doing this, or are on the way of doing this. Even some who have very few female members are talking to us about getting more through the ranks. ‚ÄúThe IRFU have made an announcement, the FAI have signalled it in terms of the retirement of the chairman, and I‚Äôve spoken to the GAA as well, who are in discussions in terms of merger with the LGFA etc - that would solve the issue. ‚ÄúIn the meantime this has to happen by the end of the year or there will be significant funding reductions." newsArray.title: Nedbank Cup: When is the Last 16 draw?
creator: Ernest Makhaya
newsArray.description: The 2023 Nedbank Cup is in full swing, and the round of 32 was completed on Tuesday with Chippa United sneaking into the Last 16 on penalties.
newsArray.content: The Nedbank Cup is in full swing, and the round of 32 was completed on Tuesday with Chippa United sneaking into the Last 16 on penalties. ALSO READ: SUNDOWNS BOLSTER TECHNICAL TEAM WITH EX-PIRATES MAN Chippa United needed penalties to beat Motsepe Foundation Championship side Polokwane City at Peter Mokaba Stadium on the night. ALSO READ | FORMER KAIZER CHIEFS MIDFIELDER FINDS A NEW HOME ‚Äì REPORT In doing so, they became the 16th team to qualify for the next round of the Nedbank Cup ‚Äì and therefore, throwing their name into the Last 16 draw. READ | KAIZER CHIEFS SET TO TIE DOWN VETERAN GOALKEEPER‚ÄôS FUTURE WHEN IS THE NEDBANK CUP LAST 16 DRAW? Now, all the 16 teams will be drawn against each other and battle it out for the eight places up for grabs in the Nedbank Cup quarter-finals. The draw for the Nedbank Cup quarter-finals will be conducted on Wednesday, 15 February at SuperSport Studio 6 in Randburg. ALSO READ | PITSO MOSIMANE‚ÄôS AL AHLI RECLAIM TOP SPOT WITH WIN This Nedbank Cup Last 16 draw is scheduled for 18:00, and by 18:30, every single team would have found out who they will face in the next round. READ ALL FOOTBALL RELATED STORIES HERE‚Ä¶

newsArray.title: Key kick-off times as DStv Premiership action returns
creator: Craig Lewis
newsArray.description: There are some key fixtures in the DStv Premiership this weekend as the chasing pack looks to make up some ground on Sundowns.
newsArray.content: Last weekend saw several Nedbank Cup clashes taking place, while Mamelodi Sundowns began their CAF Champions League campaign in victorious fashion. All eyes will be back on the DStv Premiership this weekend, though, with Pirates kicking off action on Friday night against Maritzburg United (19:30). There are three games on Saturday, with Royal AM‚Äôs battle against SuperSport United sure to be an interesting encounter, while Richards Bay will travel to face Sekhukhune United. Meanwhile, AmaZulu will also host TS Galaxy. On Sunday, Kaizer Chiefs will be hoping to come away with a comfortable victory against Golden Arrows, while Cape Town City then round off the weekend with a battle against Swallows. ALSO READ | FINALLY SOME GOOD INJURY NEWS FOR KAIZER CHIEFS Check out the DStv Premiership fixtures for this weekend below: The top half of the log currently looks like this: Runaway leaders Mamelodi Sundowns have played a couple of games more than the teams in the chasing pack, but they have established a virtually unassailable buffer. ALSO READ | CHIEFS LINKED TO AUDACIOUS MOVE FOR NIGERIAN STAR The team is now heading to Cameroon for its second ground B Match against Coton Sport Garoua, and on Tuesday it was confirmed that new set play coach Michael Loftman would be travelling with the team. ‚ÄúThe appointment was made in an effort to raise the bar including a specialist to the Technical Team,‚Äù a Sundowns statement read. ‚ÄúAll elite sport is about gaining small margins. Replays and restarts are a significant part of modern-day football and are even more crucial when playing in the CAF Champions League. ‚ÄúLoftman, who has held various coaching roles as head coach and development coach, holds a UEFA A license from the English FA and a Sports Science & Coaching Masters Degree from Brunel University. In his role, the experienced coach and performance data analyst will work on the pitch and compile analytic data to provide information to improve an important part of the game.‚Äù

newsArray.title: PSL Gossip: Kaizer Chiefs to poach a Soweto talent, Orlando Pirates star‚Äôs flashy Beemer
creator: James Freemantle
newsArray.description: In today's PSL gossip we've got news that Kaizer Chiefs may poach a Soweto rival's player and an Orlando Pirates star's flashy BMW.
newsArray.content: It‚Äôs Wednesday morning which means that it‚Äôs time for some hot PSL gossip. Today we‚Äôve got news of Kaizer Chiefs poaching an academy player from a Soweto rival and an Orlando Pirates star in his slick BMW. ICYMI: Player profile on reported Kaizer Chiefs transfer target Denis Nya! REVEALED: The accumulative transfer fees paid for Benni McCarthy PSL Gossip: 15 February 2023 Orlando Pirates star seen with half a million BMW Playing professional football for a club like Orlando Pirates is not too bad. Check out Ndabayithethwa Ndlondlo‚Äôs BMW. Want the full story?üôÇ What Jose Riveiro told Thembinkosi Lorch Orlando Pirates fans celebrated Thembinkosi Lorch‚Äôs return with a goal. Here‚Äôs what his coach told him before the big return on the grass. Want the full story?üôÇ Everything fans need to know about Kaizer Chiefs target Denis Nya If you‚Äôre a Kaizer Chiefs fan and you‚Äôre excited about rumours linking the club to Denis Nya, you should be! Here‚Äôs everything you need to know about the central defender who played alongside Kelechi Iheanacho. Want the full story?üôÇ Chiefs alerted as academy product sent packing by Swallows Kaizer Chiefs have apparently been given a heads up that midfielder Given Thibedi is available after being released by Swallows. Want the full story?üôÇ That‚Äôs all we have time for today. Until tomorrow! For more insights, analysis and love for the beautiful game, hit up James Freemantle. Meanwhile, follow The South African on Twitter for up-to-the-minute news updates

newsArray.title: Why Matildas are treating the next week as a World Cup dress rehearsal
creator: Vince Rugari
newsArray.description: It‚Äôs hard to pretend that an intimate Thursday night in Gosford gives the same vibes as 80,000 people at a Women‚Äôs World Cup opener. But Matildas coach Tony Gustavsson is going to have a crack.
newsArray.content: It might be hard to pretend that an intimate Thursday night in front of Gosford‚Äôs most famous collection of palm trees gives the same vibes as 80,000 people at a Women‚Äôs World Cup opener. But Matildas coach Tony Gustavsson is still going to have a crack at it. The Cup of Nations is here, and while there‚Äôs a trophy up for grabs, the truth is it‚Äôs meaningless. This is simply a series of friendlies dressed up as a tournament. The winners won‚Äôt be out getting tattoos to commemorate the achievement. This trophy is meaningless - but what it represents is huge for the Matildas and coach Tony Gustavsson. Credit: Getty But that doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs not important. Gustavsson and the Matildas, who face Czechia on Thursday night at Industree Group Stadium, are approaching it as a dress rehearsal for the Women‚Äôs World Cup in every conceivable way - from the three teams they‚Äôll face which were hand-picked to best replicate the attributes of their Group B opponents, to the way they‚Äôll play and even the timing, location and identity of the players who will be made available for their pre-match media commitments. Gustavsson joked he might even practice parts of the speech he‚Äôll give the team before they face Ireland at Accor Stadium on July 20. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve spent two years now talking about, you know how I always say, ‚ÄòOne day better‚Äô? This is now training tournament football,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúMeaning, how do we prepare, how do we win against Czech Republic [if it was] an opening game in a group stage? [That] is going to replicate what we‚Äôre going to talk about when we play Ireland. ‚ÄúEverything we do now is like a World Cup rehearsal. It doesn‚Äôt mean the focus is only on winning in that sense, but we need to train tournament format - how we close that game out and quickly check into something completely different tactically against Spain, and then the same thing [against Jamaica].‚Äù If nothing else, it will be an excellent measure of where the Matildas really sit after a rocky 2022 which began with a poor Asian Cup, hit the skids after concerning losses to Spain, Portugal and Canada, and then improved markedly with a series of impressive friendly performances in October and November.

newsArray.title: Snl24.com | Pique: Why I Have Not Contacted Messi
newsArray.description: Ex-Barcelona centre-back Gerard Pique has revealed why he has not contacted Lionel Messi to congratulate him for winning the 2022 FIFA World Cup with Argentina.
newsArray.content: Ex-Barcelona centre-back Gerard Pique has revealed why he has not contacted Lionel Messi to congratulate him for winning the 2022 FIFA World Cup with Argentina. After the forward left the Catalan giants as a free agent in 2021, rumours suggested that his relationship with Pique had broken down due to the Spaniard's stance over his exit. Spanish publications claimed the since-retired defender had told president Joan Laporta that Messi leaving would not impact the team negatively, with the club chief later deciding against a contract renewal for the Blaugrana's all-time leading goalscorer. Messi and Pique came through the ranks of La Masia together before eventually developing into key players for Barcelona‚Äôs senior team after the Spaniard returned to the Camp Nou following a brief stint at Manchester United. In a recent interview, Pique appeared to hint that their feud is still ongoing when he was asked if he had got in touch with his ex-colleague since his World Cup victory in December. "Not really. I was, and this is crazy but it is true, I didn't watch any game," he said in an interview with social media personality John Nellis, according to . "Just the final, not the whole game. I tried to disconnect. I went on holiday for a few days. "My last few months were tough as a pro and I really needed to disconnect from football." You must be to read and post comments

newsArray.title: Some clarity on Greenwood‚Äôs future, Man United boss reaches out
creator: Craig Lewis
newsArray.description: Embattled Manchester United forward Mason Greenwood is set to see his career remain in limbo for at least the remainder of the season.
newsArray.content: *Note: This is an updated article on Greenwood Last month, it was dramatically confirmed that all attempted rape and assault charges were dropped against Mason Greenwood after more than a year under investigation. However, it still remains to be seen what actions United will take, with the only statement to date reading as follows: ‚ÄúThe club will now conduct its own process before determining next steps. We will not make any further comment until that process is complete.‚Äù In an update reported on by The Daily Star , the internal probe will apparently could go on for several more months, and all signs suggest that there is no chance Greenwood will be considered for selection this season. The 21-year-old remains contracted to United until the middle of 2025, but has not played for the Red Devils since January 22 last year. It‚Äôs expected that the club will now interview Greenwood to ascertain his version of events and will also get specialists in to assess his mental and physical state. ALSO READ | FINALLY SOME GOOD INJURY NEWS FOR KAIZER CHIEFS It‚Äôs also been reported that United manager Erik Ten Hag got in touch with the youngster over the phone after the case was dropped. ‚ÄúThe manager enquired how he was feeling physically and mentally and said he was pleased the charges had been dropped,‚Äù a source told The Sun High-profile football publication, The Athletic , recently approached several female supporters to find out their views on any possible return for Greenwood, with the publication stating that ‚Äúwomen‚Äôs voices have been largely absent‚Äù during this story. Natalie Burrell, the founder of United Women‚Äôs Supporters‚Äô Club made her position clear: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think he should play again for Manchester United. It‚Äôs one of the biggest clubs in the world. They need to make a statement and letting him back would be the worst thing they could do. It would set our club back in terms of what we‚Äôre trying to do with our women‚Äôs team and campaigns like Her Game Too which are trying to encourage women to play and watch football.‚Äù ‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt want to see him training. I don‚Äôt want to see him in a [United] kit. I don‚Äôt want to see him ever coming out at Old Trafford again.‚Äù Another die-heard fan, named Gina, said there was no doubt about what the club should do: ‚ÄúWhile ‚Äòcharges dropped‚Äô is not conclusive either way, if there is any doubt from United that he is guilty of these allegations then I do not feel he should play for United, or any other club, again.‚Äù A third fan, 33-year-old Kaydee, echoed these sentiments. ‚ÄúThey definitely shouldn‚Äôt have him back ‚Äì not after how far the game has come to promote women. It‚Äôs just not acceptable and a club like United should know better.‚Äù READ | MASON GREENWOOD COMMENTS AFTER RAPE CHARGES DROPPED GREENWOOD HAS STILL BEEN BANKING A SIGNIFICANT SALARY FROM UNITED Towards the end of June, it was confirmed that Greenwood had his police bail extended once again as investigations continued after damning videos and images came to light on the social media account of former girlfriend Harriet Robson . Greenwood has since remained under ongoing investigation for the better part of the last year. However, a Crown Prosecution Service spokesperson explained at the start of 2023 why charges had been dropped. ‚ÄúWe have a duty to keep cases under continuous review. In this case a combination of the withdrawal of key witnesses and new material that came to light meant there was no longer a realistic prospect of conviction. In these circumstances, we are under a duty to stop the case. ‚ÄúWe have explained our decision to all parties. ‚ÄòWe would always encourage any potential victims to come forward and report to police and we will prosecute wherever our legal test is met.‚Äù In a short statement released on his behalf, Greenwood commented: ‚ÄúI am relieved that this matter is now over and I would like to thank my family, loved ones and friends for their support. There will be no further comment at this time.‚Äù Increasingly it appeared that his future with Manchester United would be viewed as untenable, but it now remains to be seen what stance the club will take.
